message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.LG 

This paper deals with identifying the language of social media messages, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also takes into account the social graph of tweet authors, which involves network analysis and could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing). Additionally, the paper deals with social media, which could fall under cs.SOC (Social and Information Networks) as well. Finally, the paper proposes a label propagation approach, which involves machine learning and could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning).
